"It was a smooth and comfortable flight. It can fly in any terrain, weather, and altitude," the minister said. He added, "Our motto is: make in India, make for the world."

177.title: 'Disappointing Adipurush' trends on Twitter, people call its VFX 'poor'
177.article_body: 'Disappointing Adipurush' has begun trending on Twitter as several users called the VFX of Prabhas-starrer poor. This comes a day after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released. A Twitter user wrote, "Even the [actor and actress] don't look real in 'Adipurush' teaser." Another user wrote, "Looks like Raavan time travelled and had a haircut in the 2020s."

178.title: Will only be left with 'hum doh hamare doh': BJP leader on Uddhav
178.article_body: BJP's Maharashtra unit president Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Monday said Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray should stop taking jibes at others or else the few party members standing by him will also leave. "He will only have 'hum doh hamare doh' and there will be no one else with him," the BJP leader said.

179.title: CNG price hiked by ₹4 per kg in Pune, to now cost ₹91 per kg
179.article_body: Maharashtra Natural Gas Ltd has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) by ₹4 per kg in Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad and adjoining areas of Chakan, Talegaon and Hinjewadi. CNG will now cost ₹91 per kg in these areas. Further, the price of Domestic Piped Natural Gas has also been increased by ₹3 and it would now cost ₹52.50 per SCM.

180.title: Apple testing under-display Touch ID but may not implement it: Report
180.article_body: Apple won't release its new iPhones with Touch ID despite testing the feature, said a report. The report said Apple tested in-screen Touch ID for the iPhone and has also considered adding Touch ID to the power button, similar to the iPad Air and iPad mini. Apple introduced the Touch ID fingerprint biometric sensor on the iPhone 5s in 2013.

181.title: Randeep Hooda begins shooting for 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'
181.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda took to Instagram to announce that he has begun shooting for his upcoming film 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'. Randeep will make his directorial debut with the film after filmmaker-actor Mahesh Manjrekar stepped down as the film's director. Randeep shared a picture holding the film's clapboard and wrote, "This is a special moment."

182.title: Bhogle asks Rohit Sharma 'How do you protect Suryakumar's form?', his reply goes viral
182.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 61(22) against South Africa, commentator Harsha Bhogle asked India captain Rohit Sharma, "How do you protect Suryakumar's form?" Rohit responded, "Just thinking not to play him anymore. Just play him on October 23 (against Pakistan)...He's somebody who wants to play...who wants to keep going out there...That's what keeps him happy and we want to keep him happy."

183.title: There's no other option, India have got to stick with current bowlers: Jaffer
183.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said death bowling is a concern for India going into the T20 WC, but there's no other option but to back the current pacers. "So close to the tournament, you don't want to chop and change," he stated. Arshdeep Singh conceded 62 runs in the second South Africa T20I, while Harshal Patel conceded 45.

184.title: Unaccounted cash, gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 cr seized from passenger in Thane
184.article_body: Unaccounted cash and two gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 crore were found in the backpack of a passenger at the Titwala railway station in Thane, an RPF official said on Monday. The accused couldn't give a satisfactory response when questioned about the source of the money and gold, the official said. The accused said that he was coming from Lucknow.

185.title: Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured as teacher slaps him in Mumbai
185.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured after a teacher allegedly slapped him during a class in Mumbai's school. The Sanskrit teacher allegedly slapped the boy on suspicion of making noises. Meanwhile, the boy's mother filed a complaint against the teacher and said that doctor's report stated that her son suffered a hole in his eardrum due to the incident.

186.title: Want to learn & teach myself what my kind of films are: Rashmika
186.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said she wants to "learn and teach" herself what her kind of films are because she hasn't figured that out yet. "This is the time for me to spread my wings and do every kind of film," she said, adding she doesn't want to get comfortable in a particular kind of genre. Rashmika's upcoming film is 'Goodbye'.

187.title: Report auto drivers asking high fares for short rides: B'luru police
187.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) on Sunday asked the city's residents to report auto drivers charging high fares for short rides. "You can call our automated IVRS to book complaints. Please call 080-22868550 / 22868444," BTP tweeted. Karnataka government had raised auto fares in November, fixing a ₹30-charge for the first two kilometres and ₹15 for every kilometre after that.

188.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook reveals 4 qualities he looks for while hiring people
188.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook, while speaking at the University of Naples Federico II's commencement ceremony, revealed the four qualities he looks for when he's hiring people. "We look for collaboration...we believe small teams can do incredible things," Cook said. "We look for creativity, for people who think different...we look for curiosity, and of course, we look for expertise," Cook added.

189.title: CIA official helped Moosewala murder accused Tinu escape police custody: FIR
189.article_body: The CIA in-charge of Mansa Police, sub-inspector Pritpal Singh, was a part of the conspiracy to help Deepak Tinu, accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, escape from police custody, an FIR said. "The CIA in-charge took him alone in his private vehicle. He did not take any other security personnel with him," the FIR said.

190.title: Path of truth is not easy: Kejriwal to Satyendar Jain on his birthday
190.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished AAP minister Satyendar Jain on his birthday, saying that path of truth is not easy. "He's been in jail for four months due to a fake case," Kejriwal tweeted. "He gave mohalla clinics...arranged for free and good treatment for everyone. These people want to stop welfare work for the public," he added.

191.title: Stop the spiral of violence and death in Ukraine: Pope Francis to Putin
191.article_body: Pope Francis "begged" Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the "spiral of violence and death" in Ukraine, adding that the crisis was risking a nuclear escalation with catastrophic global consequences. He condemned Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territories as being against international law. "I address...President of Ukraine to be open to a serious peace proposal," he added.

192.title: Nobel Prize in Medicine awarded to Svante Pääbo for his discoveries on human evolution
192.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine has been awarded to Sweden's Svante Pääbo "for his discoveries concerning the genomes of extinct hominins and human evolution". Pääbo made the discovery of an extinct hominin, the Denisova, and found that gene transfer had occurred from extinct hominins to Homo sapiens. The Nobel Assembly said that Pääbo's discovery has physiological relevance.

193.title: He's a wonderful actor, I'm pleased: Rahul on Kartik being cast in Aashiqui 3
193.article_body: Actor Rahul Roy, who made his debut with 'Aashiqui', spoke about Kartik Aaryan being cast in the third instalment of the franchise. He called Kartik a "wonderful young actor" and said that he's pleased with the casting."He has a history of picking...right films...The box-office figures are also working in Kartik's favour, so I wish him all the best," Rahul stated.

194.title: Many teams will fear playing us at T20 WC: Moeen after Eng's T20Is win vs Pak
194.article_body: Following England's 4-3 win in T20I series against Pakistan, England stand-in skipper Moeen Ali said his side is a very dangerous team to play and a lot of teams will fear playing them at upcoming T20 World Cup. "We're in a very good position now going into...World Cup," he added. England beat Pakistan by 67 runs in seventh T20I.

195.title: 2 B'luru employees found doing subpar work booked for rigging interviews
195.article_body: Siemens Healthcare, located in Bengaluru's Electronic City, has filed a case against two newly-recruited software developers and another person for allegedly rigging the interview process. The case came to light after the developers' seniors noticed they were doing subpar work. The third person, a hiring executive, was paid for telling the developers the technical questions before the interview.

196.title: If Bumrah is not available, then Mohammed Siraj: Shane Watson
196.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said pacer Mohammed Siraj should replace Jasprit Bumrah in India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup if the latter is ruled out of the tournament. "Without Bumrah, [firepower] is the one thing India won't necessarily have...Siraj is great with the brand new ball. He is fast, he swings the ball away," added Watson.

197.title: Ex-UP CM & SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted to CCU at Gurugram hospital
197.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted to the Critical Care Unit (CCU) at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. Yadav is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists, the hospital said. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks.

198.title: Hearing great reviews, not surprised: 'Ponniyin...' actor Jayam on 'Vikram...'
198.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan' actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and praised Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha'. He wrote, "Hearing great reviews about #VikramVedha...and I'm not surprised as...Tamil version was a knockout," he wrote, tagging Pushkar and Gayatri, the filmmaker duo who helmed the original film and its remake. "A big congrats to Hrithik & Saif for...success," Jayam added.

199.title: Ananya is very smart, she knows how to handle herself: Bhavana Pandey
199.article_body: Speaking about actress Ananya Panday's professional and personal choices, her mother Bhavana Pandey has said that Ananya is a smart and intelligent girl, who knows how to handle herself. "When Ananya joined the industry, she was 18 or 19 years old...that's the age when maximum learning happens," she added. Bhavana stated Ananya "literally" grew up in front of the camera.

200.title: Nykaa board announces 5:1 bonus shares issue, stock surges 11%
200.article_body: The board of FSN E-Commerce Ventures, Nykaa's parent company, has announced five bonus shares for each share a shareholder holds, the company informed the stock exchanges. Shares of FSN E-Commerce Ventures surged 11% to the day's high price of ₹1,414 on Monday after the 5:1 bonus share issue announcement. Bonus shares are fully paid additional shares issued to existing shareholders.

201.title: Man who threatened Maha CM Shinde arrested, full attention on his security: Fadnavis
201.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the person who threatened state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has been arrested. Fadnavis further said that full attention is being paid to the security of the Chief Minister. The accused had called up the police control room claiming a "plot" to kill Chief Minister Shinde at a hotel in Lonavala.

202.title: No bigger dream than this: Karan on working with Sunny Deol in 'Apne 2'
202.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol and his son Karan Deol will share screen space in 'Apne 2'. Talking about working with his father, Karan said, "No bigger dream than this where I am getting not only to work with him but also to share the screen space with him." Karan made his debut with the 2019 film 'Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas'.

203.title: EV finance firm Mufin Green raises $5.7 million in funding
203.article_body: Electric vehicle financing company Mufin Green Finance has secured $5.7 million in a Series A funding round led by Incofin India Progress Fund. In August this year, Mufin Group renamed its subsidiary APM Finvest to Mufin Green Finance Limited. The newly-listed non-banking finance company claims to have financed electric vehicles worth more than $19 million (₹160 crore) across nine states.

204.title: Bypolls to 7 Assembly seats across 6 states to be held on November 3
204.article_body: By-elections to seven Assembly seats across six states will be held on November 3. The elections will be held in Maharashtra, Bihar, Odisha, Haryana, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh. The results will be announced on November 6. A schedule shared by the Election Commission of India also mentioned that the last date for withdrawal of candidatures will be October 17.

205.title: Urmila Matondkar to make OTT debut with web series 'Tiwari'
205.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar is making her OTT debut with a thriller web series, titled 'Tiwari'. "This one offered me characters and a story arc that is challenging as a performer and things that I haven't attempted so far," she said. She added that the series is an emotional mother-daughter story at its core, with "some thrilling twists and turns".

206.title: No intention of contesting polls, will make good films on politics: Kangana
206.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she has no intentions of contesting the elections. "I look forward to serving those who are doing good for the country...Will do all kinds of propaganda for those who are serving the country...I am interested in politics as an artist. Will make good films on politics," she added.

207.title: CPWD invites pre-qualified bids for ₹360 crore PM’s residential complex
207.article_body: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) has invited pre-qualification bids for the ₹360 crore Prime Minister's residential complex. Reports said that the complex will be completed within 21 months from the date of award of the tender. It will be ground plus one storey and will include a guest house, Special Protection Group office, support staff quarters and CPWD office.

208.title: Farhan Akhtar, you front organisation called MARD: Sona on Sajid Khan
208.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation, Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "Dear Farhan Akhtar, you front an organisation called 'MARD'...Speak up...only when it's convenient or pays to virtue signal for 'our cause' not now?" In another tweet, Sona called TV channels and executives "depraved and sad lot". Sajid was accused of sexual misconduct by many women during the #MeToo movement.

209.title: Apple acknowledges microphone issue in Watch Series 8 and Ultra
209.article_body: Apple has acknowledged that some Watch Series 8 and Ultra users may experience microphone issues, MacRumors reported citing a memo. It said the users may face trouble when trying to use Siri or making a phone call, among other things. Apple said restarting the device may temporarily fix the problem and suggested the problem is not hardware related.

210.title: Pastor kills neighbour's pet dog with air gun in Andhra; booked
210.article_body: A 65-year-old pastor was booked for allegedly shooting his neighbour's pet dog with an air gun and killing it under Nandigama police station limits in Andhra Pradesh. The incident took place when the dog started barking after entering the pastor's home, a police officer said. "[The pastor] had warned...neighbours against this several times in the past," the police officer added.

211.title: Delhi govt initiates trial run of 26 new bus routes in city
211.article_body: The Delhi government initiated the trial run of 26 new bus routes in the city. The routes were drawn up under a route rationalisation plan to provide better connectivity to major crowd centres, including poorly served areas, officials said. A four-member committee was formed to oversee the rationalisation plan to make sure that bus routes are evenly spread across Delhi.

212.title: Adam Gilchrist names his 5 players for dream World T20I XI
212.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist has named the first five players he would pick in a dream World T20I XI. He included Australia opener David Warner, Pakistan captain Babar Azam, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan and England white-ball captain Jos Buttler. "He is just an awesome figure straight across the board," Gilchrist said about Pandya.

213.title: Will show unknown facets of her life: Madhubala’s sister on actress' biopic
213.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Brij Bhushan said the late actress' biopic "will showcase several unknown facets" of her life. She said the film will put several inaccuracies about her life to rest. Madhur added that she won't let anyone else make any project based on or inspired by Madhubala's life and called the biopic her "family's emotional and legal right".

214.title: China's Geely buys 7.6% stake in Aston Martin
214.article_body: China-based Zhejiang Geely announced on Friday that it has bought a 7.6% stake in British luxury carmaker Aston Martin. However, the financial details of the deal were not disclosed. Geely's stake is valued at about $74 million, based on Thursday's closing share price. Aston Martin also separately announced the completion of a $732 million capital raise.

215.title: 35-yr-old man dies while dancing, his 66-yr-old father dies of shock in Maha
215.article_body: A 35-year-old man collapsed and died while dancing at a garba event in Maharashtra's Virar, the police said on Monday. The man was rushed to the hospital by his 66-year-old father and was declared dead on arrival. On hearing about his son's death, the father also collapsed and died on the spot, the police said.

216.title: What a disgrace: Infosys ex-CFO Pai on B'luru in bottom 3 in cleanliness rankings
216.article_body: Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai took to Twitter to share his disappointment after Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities in the government's latest Swachh Survekshan rankings. "What a disgrace! India's only global city, the richest city has become a garbage city! We are ashamed," he tweeted. Demanding "urgent reforms", Pai tagged Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai in his tweet.

217.title: Met Gala 2023 to celebrate work of late designer Karl Lagerfeld
217.article_body: Met Gala 2023 will celebrate the work of the late German-born couturier Karl Lagerfeld, who passed away in 2019. The Met Gala theme is borrowed from the accompanying exhibit at the Met's Costume Institute, titled 'Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty'. The exhibition will gather around 150 of Karl's creations to explore his "stylistic language".

218.title: I'm scared, Pakistan might crash out in 1st round of 2022 T20 WC: Akhtar
218.article_body: Criticising the Babar Azam-led Pakistan, ex-pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said their middle-order is "not good" going into the 2022 T20 World Cup. "With this team, we might get knocked out in the first round itself. I'm really scared as our batting has no depth. Our captain is also not cut out for this format...He wants to look classic," stated Shoaib.

219.title: Businessman, actor, filmmaker Atlas Ramachandran passes away at 80 in Dubai
219.article_body: Kerala-born businessman MM Ramachandran, popularly known as Atlas Ramachandran, passed away at the age of 80 in Dubai on Sunday night after a cardiac arrest, according to reports. He was the founder of now-defunct Atlas Jewellery and produced several Malayalam films. He had also acted in several films.

220.title: Half of mobilised men in Russian region sent home, commissar fired
220.article_body: The military commissar of Russia's Khabarovsk, Yuri Laiko, was removed after half of the newly mobilised personnel were sent home as they failed to meet the draft criteria, region's Governor Mikhail Degtyaryov said. "Removal of the commissar would not affect the mobilisation plan," he added. Officials and citizens have complained that enlistment officers sent call-up papers to ineligible men.

221.title: Kareena gets scared as man keeps hand on her shoulder for selfies; video surfaces
221.article_body: A video showing actress Kareena Kapoor Khan getting scared and uncomfortable after a man kept his hand on her shoulder for selfies at Mumbai airport is being widely circulated on social media. Kareena's security staff could be seen pushing the man away. The actress was surrounded by a group of fans who were trying to click pictures with her.

222.title: PM Modi to inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyd
222.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyderabad on October 11. The conference's theme is "Geo-Enabling the Global Village: No one should be left behind". PM Modi-led government is "playing an enabler's role in expanding...scope of geospatial applications in multiple spheres to benefit every section of the society in India," Union Minister Jitendra Singh said.

223.title: Celsius' ex-CEO withdrew $10 million before firm froze customer accounts: Report
223.article_body: Founder and former CEO of Celsius Network Alex Mashinsky allegedly withdrew $10 million from the cryptocurrency platform weeks before it froze customer funds and filed bankruptcy, as per a report. He reportedly withdrew the funds in "mid to late May" while the platform paused customer withdrawals in June. Celsius in July filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy citing "extreme market conditions".

224.title: Pune secures 9th rank among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan
224.article_body: Pune city’s ranking has dropped to ninth from last year's fifth in terms of cleanliness in the Centre's annual Swachh Survekshan. Indore was adjudged the country's cleanest city for the sixth time in a row. The Swachh Survekshan competition is organised every year by the central government among 45 cities with a population of more than 10 lakh people.

225.title: There’s no G-23 group, it was all media’s idea: Cong’s Shashi Tharoor
225.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday said, "There’s no G-23 group, it was all the media’s idea." Furthermore, he said, "A couple of senior leaders wrote a letter, they invited a large number of people to support them…COVID-19 lockdown was on in 2020 and at that time only 23 leaders were available in Delhi to sign the letter."

226.title: Auto driver gets into a head-on collision with SUV in Chandigarh, killed
226.article_body: An auto driver was killed in a head-on collision with a car in front of the Sector 34 parade ground in Chandigarh on Saturday. Reports said he was driving in front of the exhibition ground when he collided with a white Ford EcoSport SUV. He was rushed to Government Medical College and Hospital in sector 32 but died during treatment.

227.title: Pak is not as dominant, it's Indo-Pac with 'C', not Indo-Pak with 'K': British envoy
227.article_body: British High Commissioner to India, Alex Ellis, has said that Pakistan is not as dominant as it once was, adding, "Our focus has shifted towards India." He said, "I keep saying, it is Indo-Pac with a 'C' rather than Indo-Pak with a 'K'." The UK's relationship has changed with Pakistan a lot as it withdrew from Afghanistan, he added.

228.title: We've competed well & we can walk away with our heads held high: Miller
228.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has said it's "very disappointing" to lose the T20I series against India, but they've competed well in recent games and they can "at least walk away with their heads held high". "I don't think it's too much to worry about," he added. Chasing India's 238-run target, Miller smashed 106*(47) to help SA get to 221/3.

229.title: Sonia Gandhi to participate in Bharat Jodo Yatra on October 6: Reports
229.article_body: According to reports, Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi will participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra on October 6 in Karnataka. This will be Sonia Gandhi's first participation in the yatra, which began while she was abroad for a medical check-up. The yatra will pass through Karnataka for 21 days, covering 511 km in the state.

230.title: Poverty in country standing like 'demon' in front of us: RSS' Hosabale
230.article_body: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale on Sunday said that poverty in the country is standing like a "demon" in front of us. "It's important that we slay this demon. That 20 crore people are still below...poverty line is a figure that should make us very sad...As many as 23 crore people have less than ₹375 income per day," Hosabale added.

231.title: 11-year-old boy kidnapped from Gr Noida, rescued within 24 hours
231.article_body: An 11-year-old boy who was kidnapped from Greater Noida has been rescued by the police within 24 hours. The boy's family approached police after the kidnappers called his father and asked for ₹30 lakh. The kidnappers began to fire shots when the police intercepted them, following which, police fired back and two of the kidnappers were injured, an official said.

232.title: 2 settlements in Kherson region liberated: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy
232.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that the country's forces have liberated two settlements of Arkhanhelske and Myrolyubivka in Kherson region. During his nightly address, Zelenskyy thanked Ukrainian forces. Earlier in his address, Zelenskyy mentioned that the success of Ukrainian forces is not limited to the recapture of the city of Lyman in Donetsk region.

233.title: 21-yr-old Guj man dies of heart attack while performing garba; incident caught on camera
233.article_body: A video showing a 21-year-old man suddenly collapsing while performing garba in Gujarat's Anand has surfaced online. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him dead and said that he died of a heart attack. Last month, a 20-year-old artist died while dancing on stage in Jammu and Kashmir.

234.title: Nitish Kumar calls Akhilesh, enquires about Mulayam Singh's health
234.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar spoke to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to enquire about the health of Mulayam Singh, who was shifted to the ICU at the Medanta hospital in Gurugram on Sunday. "Mulayam Singh's health is stable…His oxygen levels decreased a little bit but as per doctors, there is no need to worry," said SP leader Rakesh Yadav.

235.title: Prez pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi, spins charkha at Sabarmati ashram
235.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Sabarmati ashram on Monday in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. She also spun the charkha at the ashram, a video of which has surfaced online. Murmu, who is on a two-day tour of Gujarat, will later inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for projects worth ₹1,330 crore in Gandhinagar, according to a government release.

236.title: EPAM Systems asks 100 Indian employees to resign, revokes offer letters: Report
236.article_body: NYSE-listed IT services provider EPAM Systems reportedly asked around 100 Indian employees to resign and has also revoked offer letters of others who were about to join the firm in the next few months. As per a report, HR managers told the affected staff that the company over-hired, misjudged demand forecasts, and couldn't fund onboarding projects in the near future.

237.title: I was really frightened to do 'Adipurush': Prabhas
237.article_body: Prabhas said he was "really frightened" to portray the character of Lord Ram in 'Adipurush'. "With a lot of love, respect and fear we did this film. May Lord Ram bless us," Prabhas added. Kriti Sanon, who plays Janaki in the Om Raut directorial, called the film "a dream experience". She added, "I just hope I don't disappoint you all."

238.title: We lacked belief: Man Utd coach Ten Hag on defeat against Man City
238.article_body: Manchester United coach Erik ten Hag has said they "lacked the belief" and weren't "brave enough" in their game against Manchester City as they lost 3-6 on Sunday. "In the last five games we had a strong belief...it was the other way around [against City]," he stated. United had registered wins in their last four games in the Premier League.

239.title: Flight tracking website shows plane with 'bomb threat' reducing altitude over Delhi-Jaipur
239.article_body: Flightradar24 data shows Mahan Air flight (IRM081) reducing altitude over Delhi-Jaipur airspace before making its way out of the Indian airspace, ANI reported. Delhi Police received inputs about a bomb threat on the plane from Iran to China, ANI said. The plane wasn't allowed to land in Delhi and was reportedly asked to divert to Jaipur but the pilots refused.

240.title: 1 killed, 2 rescued after building collapses during demolition in Gurugram
240.article_body: One labourer was killed after a three-storey old building collapsed during demolition in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar. Two labourers were successfully rescued. The building was being demolished since September 26. Police said that two floors of the building had already been demolished. Fire Officer Lalit Kumar had earlier said that rescue ops were underway.

241.title: Didn’t know if '83' will open Bollywood's doors for me: Harrdy Sandhu
241.article_body: Singer-actor Harrdy Sandhu said he didn't know if '83' would open Bollywood doors for him. Harrdy said the film was God's gift to him as, with it, he fulfilled his wish to become a cricketer. Harrdy will now be seen in 'Code Name: Tiranga' with Parineeti Chopra. "It never felt like we haven't met ever," Harrdy said about Parineeti.

242.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan' earns ₹202.87 crore worldwide on opening weekend
242.article_body: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' has earned ₹202.87 crore at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. Trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan on Monday shared that the film earned ₹78.29 crore, ₹60.16 crore and ₹64.42 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, respectively. He also informed that the film collected ₹69.71 crore in Tamil Nadu.

243.title: NCP leader recalls Pawar’s rally after Rahul’s speech in Mysuru amid rains
243.article_body: After Congress' Rahul Gandhi addressed a rally in Mysuru amid heavy rains on Sunday, NCP's Clyde Crasto drew parallels between Rahul's address and NCP chief Sharad Pawar’s rain-drenched speech during bypoll campaign in 2019. Crasto tweeted pictures of both the leaders, saying, "When the rain Gods decide to bless you, there will soon be a storm in the Opposition camp."

244.title: PayU terminates $4.7 billion deal to acquire BillDesk
244.article_body: Prosus on Monday announced that it is terminating the agreement signed by its subsidiary PayU to acquire Indian online payments gateway BillDesk for $4.7 billion. The decision to terminate the deal comes nearly a month after the CCI approved the deal. Prosus said certain conditions precedent were not fulfilled by the long stop date and the agreement has terminated automatically.

245.title: UK drops plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for highest earners
245.article_body: The UK government has announced it will not go ahead with the plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for the country's highest earners. The reversal comes 10 days after the measure was first announced. "It's clear that...abolition of...45p tax rate has become a distraction from our overriding mission to tackle...challenges facing our economy," Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng said.

246.title: Humbled & honoured: Devgn on winning 2 National Awards for 'Tanhaji...'
246.article_body: Ajay Devgn said he is "humbled and honoured" to have won two National Awards, one as a Producer of Best Film and one as Best Actor, for his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "This is my third win as Best Actor. I feel elated yet humbled each time this happens," he added. Ajay shared his Best Actor award with Suriya.

247.title: Amitabh Bachchan is an absolutely brilliant performer: Rashmika
247.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said her 'Goodbye' co-star Amitabh Bachchan "is an absolutely brilliant performer". She added, "A gem of a person who always argues with me as a reel papa." Rashmika said she's grateful to have worked with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Goodbye'. "It's been an absolute honour and this will forever be super special," she wrote.

248.title: He never makes you feel like an outsider: Jayam Ravi on Mani Ratnam
248.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi said Director Mani Ratnam "never makes you feel like an outsider". Ravi, who plays Chola king Rajaraja in Mani's 'Ponniyin Selvan', said he met the "sweetest people" while working on the film. "I've worked with Trisha before, and Vikram is like my brother. Karthi and I have become brothers now. That's the bond we have," he added.

249.title: Honour for weavers: T'gana minister on Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing
249.article_body: Telangana minister T Harish Rao has thanked weavers from Siddipet over Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing and described it as an "honour" to the skill of the weavers. Rao is the MLA for Siddipet. Gollabhama sarees were mentioned in UNESCO's "Handmade for the 21st Century: Safeguarding Traditional Indian Textile" list along with Himroo weaving and Gongadi sheep wool blankets, among others.

250.title: More than 80 people killed due to Hurricane Ian, rescue efforts underway
250.article_body: More than 80 people have died due to Hurricane Ian. Hundreds of thousands of people in Florida and the Carolinas are left without electricity. The National Guard and the Coast Guard flew helicopters over Florida's barrier islands to rescue people. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will visit Puerto Rico on Monday and Florida on Wednesday.

251.title: We restricted them to 106 in 1st game: Rahul on India's bowling in 2nd SA T20I
251.article_body: Defending India's bowling in the second T20I against South Africa, KL Rahul said though there's room for the bowlers to improve, the conditions should also be considered. "Two days back, they got SA bowled out for 106...there was a little bit of dew [today], it's also a very humid place, so it's hard for the bowlers to grip," he explained.

252.title: 3 men walking on railway tracks in MP die after moving train hits them
252.article_body: Three men walking on railway tracks were killed when they were hit by a moving train in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar, police said. The incident took place on Sunday evening. The deceased have been identified as 26-year-old Dharmendra Yadav, 30-year-old Sanju Ghoshi and 28-year-old Rajkumar Yadav, an official said. Police have registered a case.

253.title: IAF inducts 1st batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters
253.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Monday inducted the first batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) at the Jodhpur Air Force base in Rajasthan. The ceremony was led by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, the Light Combat Helicopters are capable of destroying enemy air defence and can be deployed in counter-insurgency operations.

254.title: 10-year-old boy rapes 6-year-old girl in animal shed in UP
254.article_body: Police has detained a 10-year-old boy for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The girl was playing outside her home when the accused allegedly lured her and took her with him to a cattle shed. Police said that necessary legal action is being taken against the accused after taking him into the custody as per the law.

255.title: Medicines may soon get QR codes to check for their authenticity: Reports
255.article_body: In a bid to prevent the use of counterfeit and substandard medicines, the central government may soon launch a "track and trace" mechanism, under which QR codes will be printed on the primary packaging labels, as per reports. The QR codes will allow consumers to check the authenticity of the drugs while providing them with additional information.

256.title: 'Bomb threat' on China-bound Iranian plane over Indian airspace, IAF jets scrambled: Report
256.article_body: Indian Air Force fighter jets from Punjab and Jodhpur were scrambled to intercept an Iranian passenger aircraft that was moving towards New Delhi's airspace on Monday as security agencies received inputs about the possibility of a bomb on board, ANI reported. The plane was not allowed to land in Delhi and is now moving towards China, ANI added.

257.title: Centre should provide weekly money to needy families as social security: Gehlot
257.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the Centre should provide money on a weekly basis as social security to all needy people in the country. "Why shouldn't families compulsorily get weekly money like other countries? This will help in running families...only those who need it will get [it]," Gehlot asked. "You go to London, America, social security is everywhere," he stated.

258.title: ISRO's Mars orbiter runs out of fuel 8 years after launch, loses link: Officials
258.article_body: The Mars orbiter launched by the ISRO in 2013 has run out of propellant and its battery has drained beyond the safe limit, PTI reported citing officials. The Mars Orbiter Mission reportedly entered a long eclipse period in April and lost contact with ground station. The ₹450-crore craft, designed to last only for six months, orbited Mars for eight years.

259.title: Telangana CM KCR to enter national politics on Vijayadashami: Reports
259.article_body: According to reports, Telangana CM KCR is expected to enter into national politics on Vijayadashami, which is on October 5. The particulars of the plan are being worked out and the TRS could be renamed. On September 5, He had announced that free electricity would be supplied to farmers across the country if a non-BJP government comes to power.

260.title: PE, VC funding to Indian startups slowed 20% in 2022: Report
260.article_body: The funding coming into Indian startups through private equity (PE) and venture capital (VC) reduced from 949 investments worth $45.4 billion in January-September 2021 to 1,016 investments worth $36 billion in the same period this year, Venture Intelligence data showed. The funding slowed a little over 20% by value in the first nine months of 2022.

261.title: Ghaziabad Police arrest 6 people for vandalising Durga Puja pandal
261.article_body: Ghaziabad Police on Sunday arrested six people for allegedly vandalising a Durga Puja pandal in Sahibabad. According to the complaint, a person claimed that his neighbour objected to the loud music at the pandal, however, even after the music's volume was lowered, the suspects vandalised the pandal and fought with the organisers, a police station in charge said.

262.title: Odisha CM launches month-long 'Jana Sampark Padyatra' from Bhubaneswar
262.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launched BJD's month-long "Jana Sampark Padyatra" from Bhubaneswar. "The padyatra will be organised across the state starting from ward, panchayat, town and Assembly segment, every leader and worker of the party will go to the people and inform them about the development work across the sectors," said Debi Mishra, Vice President of BJD.

263.title: Margot Robbie, Cara's friends break arm of photographer taking their pics: Report
263.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie and model-actress Cara Delevingne's filmmaker friends were arrested for attacking a photographer aggressively taking their photos in Argentina's Buenos Aires, according to reports. The photographer's arm was reportedly broken after the fight. Robbie nearly fell out of a car because of the photographer, following which their friends intervened, reports added.

264.title: David Miller breaks world record for highest-ever score by a no. 5 batter in T20I cricket
264.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has broken the world record for registering the highest-ever score by a number five batter in T20I cricket. The 33-year-old slammed an unbeaten 106 off 47 deliveries against India in second T20I to set the record. The previous record was held by Romania's Sivakumar Periyalwar, who had slammed 105*(40) against Turkey on August 29, 2019.

265.title: We need to improve in the T20Is: Babar Azam after 67-run defeat vs Eng
265.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said they need to improve in the shortest format of the game after losing the seventh T20I against England on Sunday. "With 200 runs on the board, if we lose early wickets, it puts pressure on the other batters. This series was vital for us," added Babar. Batting first, England posted 209/3 in the game.

266.title: England finish their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with 4-3 series win
266.article_body: England finished their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with a 67-run win in the final T20I on Sunday, claiming the seven-match series 4-3. England won the first, third, sixth and seventh T20I, with 23-year-old batter Harry Brook being named the 'Player of the Series' for scoring a total of 238 runs. Muhammad Rizwan (316 runs) top-scored for Pakistan.

267.title: India reports 3,011 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 36,126
267.article_body: India reported 3,011 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country went down to 36,126 from the earlier 37,444, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,701. The weekly positivity rate currently stands at 1.31%.

268.title: Mitchell Johnson pushes Yusuf Pathan amid fight during Legends League Cricket match
268.article_body: India Capitals' Mitchell Johnson and Bhilwara Kings' Yusuf Pathan got involved in a fight during their Legends League Cricket match. In a video that went viral on social media, the duo can be seen arguing with each other before Johnson pushes Yusuf away. The umpires can then be seen intervening. Yusuf scored 48(24) in the match.

269.title: Surprised I'm getting this, Surya had bigger impact: Rahul on Player of the Match award
269.article_body: After being named Player of the Match for scoring 57(28) in the second T20I against South Africa, India opener KL Rahul said, "Quite honestly I am surprised, I am getting the award." He added, "Suryakumar Yadav had a bigger impact on the game. He changed the game," Rahul said. Suryakumar scored 61 runs off 22 deliveries.

270.title: 4 kids drown in tank while trying to save each other in Ranga Reddy
270.article_body: Four children, aged between nine and 14, drowned in a tank under Yacharam police station limits in Ranga Reddy on Sunday, police said. The children died one by one as they tried to save each other, a police inspector said. The District Collector has announced a ₹50,000 ex-gratia to each of the deceased's families, the police inspector added.

271.title: Bengaluru ranks 43 among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan ranking
271.article_body: Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities surveyed under the Swachh Survekshan, a steep downfall from the 28th spot in the previous year. While Madhya Pradesh's Indore was ranked first in the list for the sixth consecutive year, Surat and Navi Mumbai stood second and third. Bengaluru was better only than Chennai and Madurai, which were in the bottom two.

272.title: 60 cr people changed habit of open defecation: Prez at Swachh Bharat Diwas event
272.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday said since the launch of ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ in 2014, over 11 crore toilets have been constructed and about 60 crore people have changed their habit of open defecation. She said that ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ is a behaviour-change movement. President Murmu was addressing an event to celebrate Swachh Bharat Diwas in New Delhi.

273.title: 60-year-old farmer dies of heart attack at protest site in Punjab
273.article_body: A 60-year-old farmer died of a heart attack at a protest site in Punjab's Gumjal village. The deceased was an activist of BKU (Rajewal), which is holding a protest over compensation for damaged cotton crop and availability of canal water. "We'll not cremate...body till...government doesn't announce ₹1 crore compensation...government job and debt waiver for...shaheed kisaan," a farm leader said.

274.title: Pune Municipal Corporation issues work order for e-bike rental service
274.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) issued a work order to a private firm to introduce e-bikes on rent and set up 250 charging stations across the city in the next two months. "The proposal to implement the e-bike rental project will be done in a phase-wise manner," said Shrinivas Kandul, head of the electrical department, PMC.

275.title: Muslim, Hindu inmates hold Navratri fast for communal harmony in UP
275.article_body: As many as 218 Muslim inmates and 1,104 Hindu inmates are observing the Navratri fast at a jail in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for communal harmony, a jail superintendent said. The jail superintendent added that the prison authorities have made special arrangements for fruits, milk and 'kuttu' flour. The Muslim inmates are apparently fasting in solidarity with the Hindu inmates.

276.title: Man injured after high-tension wire explodes in his hand at Pune station
276.article_body: A man received 80 per cent burn injuries after he grabbed a high-tension wire while walking on the roof of a train in Pune. A video of the incident has gone viral. The man received a shock as soon as he touched the wire above him and fell off the roof of the train. He was admitted to a hospital.

277.title: 3-storey building collapses while demolition in Gurugram, 3 labourers trapped
277.article_body: A three-storey building that was being demolished since September 26, collapsed in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar. Three labourers are reported to be trapped under the collapsed building. Fire Officer Lalit Kumar said that the rescue operations are currently underway and that one labourer has been rescued. Two floors of the building had already been demolished, police said.

278.title: Man poses as UP policeman, extorts cash from locals in Firozabad; held
278.article_body: The Firozabad Police have arrested a man for posing as a policeman and extorting money from locals. According to reports, the accused, Mukesh Yadav, was arrested while he was accepting money from vehicles in the city. The police recovered a fake Aadhaar card, a fake ID card of Police Inspector, a photo in police uniform and other items from him.

279.title: Pegasus used to attack 3 activists in Mexico between 2019-21: Report
279.article_body: Phones of at least two journalists and a human rights activist in Mexico were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021, researchers at Citizen Lab said in a report. The findings noted that the three victims had documented alleged human rights abuses by Mexico's armed forces. Pegasus can be used to remotely break into phones and access information.

280.title: Alfaaz is still serious in ICU, please pray for him: Honey Singh
280.article_body: Yo Yo Honey Singh on Monday took to Instagram to post that Punjabi singer Alfaaz, who was hit by a tempo truck on Saturday night, is still serious in the ICU and requested his fans to pray for him. Alfaaz was admitted to a private hospital in Mohali with multiple injuries. Police on Sunday arrested the vehicle driver, Vicky.

281.title: Pak bowling coach Tait says 'When we lose badly, they send me to presser'; video viral
281.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait's reaction on being sent to the press conference following Pakistan's defeat in sixth T20I against England. "So when we lose badly...they send me [to press conference]," Tait said at start of the press conference. England won the sixth T20I by eight wickets and the seventh T20I by 67 runs.

282.title: iPhone detects impact, alerts police after car crashes into tree killing 6 people in US
282.article_body: An iPhone 14 automatically alerted emergency responders after a car crashed into a tree in US. While the cause of crash is yet to be determined, police said the iPhone detected the impact and called responders when the phone's owner didn't respond. All six occupants of the car, five men and a woman aged between 21 and 24, were killed.

283.title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire's 168-ft superyacht put on sale for £26 million
283.article_body: A 168-foot superyacht linked to sanctioned Russian billionaire Igor Kesaev has been put on sale for £26 million. The MySky superyacht, whose interiors have been designed by Dutch architect Erick van Egeraat, comes with a gym, helicopter landing deck and five cabins. The EU and UK sanctioned Kesaev in April in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

284.title: I had to keep the tempo set by Rohit, Rahul: Suryakumar on 61(22)
284.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 61(22) against South Africa on Sunday, said he just went in to bat and enjoyed himself. "We were batting first, so...I had to keep the tempo that was set by Rahul and Rohit," he added. Notably, Suryakumar has now become the fastest batter to reach 1,000 T20I runs in terms of balls faced (573).

285.title: 3,200 MT wheat meant for public distribution decays in Haryana
285.article_body: Nearly 3,200 metric tonnes of wheat, which was meant for public distribution, has decayed due to negligence in Haryana's Kaithal. The decayed wheat is estimated to be worth ₹ 6.5 crore, officials said. State Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department Director Mukul Kumar said that the matter is being investigated and action will be taken.

286.title: No G-23 camp now, all leaders united to fight against BJP, RSS: Cong's Kharge
286.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said that the dissenting "G-23 camp" no longer exists. "All leaders (of G-23) want to work together to stay united and fight against BJP-RSS. This is the reason they are supporting me," he added. "Many senior leaders of the party have supported my nomination for Congress President post," Kharge stated.

287.title: Astronaut shares pics of Dead Sea from space; says 'Intrigued by these straight lines'
287.article_body: Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti has shared pictures of Dead Sea from the International Space Station. "I was...intrigued by these straight lines at the southern end of the Dead Sea - turns out it's a complex of Jordanian salt evaporation ponds," she wrote. She also shared pictures of Israel's Haifa and Tel Aviv at night.

288.title: 3 killed, 64 injured after massive fire breaks out at Durga Puja pandal in UP
288.article_body: Three people were killed while 64 others were injured in a massive fire that broke out at a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Sunday night. The deceased include a 45-year-old woman and two boys aged 10 and 12. Police said that the fire broke out when aarti was being performed at the pandal.

289.title: Rahul addresses public in Karnataka amid heavy rainfall, video surfaces
289.article_body: Rahul Gandhi addressed the public amid heavy rainfall as part of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Sunday evening. A video of him speaking amid rains has surfaced online. During his speech, he said that rain, heat or storms can't stop the yatra. In the video, he can be seen drenched while speaking to the public.

290.title: Bihar remains poorest, most backward since 1990: Prashant Kishor
290.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Sunday said Bihar's condition has not changed since 1990. "In 1990, Bihar was the poorest and most backward and in 2022, it still remains the same. People here are bound to migrate to other states," Kishor added. "We've been listening...education and health services would be improved but nothing has changed in the state," he stated.

291.title: Punjabi singer Alfaaz hospitalised after being hit by reversing tempo truck, 1 arrested
291.article_body: Punjabi singer Alfaaz was admitted to a hospital with multiple injuries after a reversing tempo truck hit him outside a dabha in Punjab on Saturday. The vehicle was driven by a former employee of the dhaba, who was trying to flee with it over a payment dispute with the eatery's owner, said police. The accused, Vicky, was arrested on Sunday.

292.title: 8-bedroom villa on Dubai's Palm Jumeirah island sells for record ₹671.5 crore
292.article_body: A mansion built on Palm Jumeirah island sold for $82.4 million (₹671.5 crore), making it the most expensive home to be sold in Dubai. The villa is still under construction and will include a gym, cinema, bowling alley and jacuzzi. The sale of 8-bedroom mansion broke previous record set by industrialist Mukesh Ambani who paid $80 million for 10-bedroom villa.

293.title: We need to get our act together: Rohit on death-overs bowling
293.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their 16-run win against South Africa on Sunday, India captain Rohit Sharma admitted that they haven't bowled well in the death overs in recent matches. "It is not concerning, but we need to pick ourselves and get our act together," added Rohit. Put in to bat, India posted 237/3, with Suryakumar Yadav scoring 61(22).

294.title: Yuzvendra Chahal jokingly kicks Tabraiz Shamsi, video goes viral
294.article_body: A video went viral showing India's Yuzvendra Chahal jokingly kicking South Africa's Tabraiz Shamsi inside the ground during the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati. Chahal and Shamsi, who weren't playing the match, had come on the pitch during a forced break in South Africa's third over. "Yuzvendra...I'm coming for you," Shamsi jokingly wrote while sharing a video on Instagram.

295.title: GB Nagar police arrests 2 robbers after brief gunfight; 1 injured
295.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar police arrested two alleged robbers after a brief gunfight under Sector 24 police station limits and recovered two guns with live cartridges along with ₹5,670 cash from their possession. One of the suspects was injured in the leg in retaliatory firing by the police and was taken to a hospital, ADCP (Noida) Ashutosh Dwivedi said.

296.title: Indian javelin thrower Shivpal Singh banned for 4 years for failing dope test
296.article_body: Indian javelin thrower Shivpal Singh has been banned for four years for failing a dope test that was conducted last year by NADA's Anti-Doping Disciplinary Panel. Shivpal, who took part in Tokyo Olympics, was placed under provisional suspension in October last year after he failed an out-of-competition test. He had tested positive for the banned substance Methandienone.

297.title: Traffic advisory issued over 'Saddula Bathukamma' in Hyd for today
297.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued a traffic advisory in connection to 'Saddula Bathukamma' which will be celebrated today at LB Stadium, Liberty Junction and Upper Tank bund and cause traffic congestion from 3 pm to 9 pm. The traffic police requested people to avoid 20 junctions where traffic congestion is expected to be heavy, like Basheerbagh, Khairatabad and PCR Junction.

298.title: Expert panel to approve artwork themes for Mumbai bridges to be set up
298.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up an expert advisory panel for approving themes for murals, paintings, artworks and graffiti on the existing bridges in Mumbai. "There are so many bridges like Hancock and Carnac that have a history of more than 100 years. We need to carefully restore their heritage," a BMC official said.

299.title: Real Madrid Prez backs Super League using Nadal & Djokovic's example
299.article_body: Real Madrid President Florentino Perez has reportedly backed the Super League by using the example of tennis stars Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic. "Nadal and Djokovic have played against 59 times...This has boosted tennis...Real Madrid and Liverpool have only met 9 times in 67 years," said Perez. UEFA had threatened to blacklist any club that pursued the idea.

300.title: Man Utd fans reportedly leave at half-time after City scored 4 goals
300.article_body: Some Manchester United fans reportedly left the Etihad Stadium at half-time during the team's match against Manchester City. Two goals each from Erling Haaland and Phil Foden had put City 4-0 ahead at half-time on Sunday. The match ended 6-3 for City with Haaland and Foden scoring a hat-trick and Anthony Martial scoring two goals for United.

301.title: You need to listen to me: Hamilton to Mercedes during Singapore GP
301.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton got angry at his team during the Singapore Grand Prix over tyre choices leading to him being passed by Ferrari's Carlos Sainz in the opening laps. "I told you about these tyres, in future you need to listen to me," said Hamilton over the team radio. After starting third, Hamilton finished the race in ninth.

302.title: Logistical challenges impact Tesla's EV deliveries in Q3
302.article_body: Tesla Inc said that electric vehicle deliveries in the third quarter were lower than expected and said they were impacted due to logistical challenges. The company delivered a record 3,43,830 EVs, lesser than the 3,59,162 expected, according to Refinitiv. "Historically, our delivery volumes have skewed towards the end of each quarter due to regional batch building of cars," Tesla said.

303.title: She's like a sister to me: Hima on 100m National Games gold medallist Jyothi
303.article_body: Sprinter Hima Das praised Jyothi Yarraji after she clinched the gold medal in the 100-metre final at 36th National Games. "Jyothi is like a sister to me. I was the happiest to see her perform so well. She listens to me...as a person, she's really nice," said Hima. Jyothi clocked 11.51s, while Hima finished seventh with a timing of 11.74s.

304.title: Finance Ministry to launch special financial inclusion drive from Oct 15
304.article_body: The Finance Ministry took to Twitter to announce a special financial inclusion drive to achieve saturation bank accounts and expansion of Kisan Credit Card coverage. The drive will run from October 15 to November 26 and focus on mobile/Aadhaar seeding of existing accounts with special focus on making small accounts normal accounts by doing full KYC.

305.title: India invites US firms to invest in oil and gas production at investors meet
305.article_body: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MoPNG) showcased India's fiscal policies and conducive environment to attract US firms to invest in India's energy and petroleum sector during a two-day investors meet in Houston. MoPNG Secretary Pankaj Jain, in his address, highlighted India's offering of discovered fields and assured an open-door policy to resolve any issue faced by the industry.

306.title: India win a T20I series against SA on home soil for 1st time ever, break multiple records
306.article_body: India defeated South Africa by 16 runs to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. It's the first time that India clinched a T20I series against South Africa at home. India recorded their highest-ever T20I total (237/3) against South Africa. Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 1,000 T20I runs in terms of balls faced (573).

307.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states for next 4 days, list released
307.article_body: The IMD has stated that heavy rainfall is very likely over Jharkhand, West Bengal, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura on October 3 and 4. It's very likely over Odisha till October 6. Andhra Pradesh, Bihar and Chhattisgarh may witness it on October 4 and 5. Telangana, UP and Madhya Pradesh may witness it on October 5 and 6.

308.title: Life without AR will soon be unthinkable: Apple CEO Tim Cook
308.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said that soon we will be looking at life before Augmented Reality (AR). "AR apps are already in the App Store, but the possibilities will go much, much further," he said. Calling it "a profound technology", Cook said that AR will soon affect everything including teaching and medicine.

309.title: TRAI to propose unified KYC system to stop fraudulent calls: Chairman
309.article_body: TRAI Chairman PD Vaghela said TRAI is planning to set up a unified know-your-customer system, which should be accessible by all telecom operators, to check fraudulent callers and spammers. Speaking at India Mobile Congress, Vaghela said spammers have started using multiple numbers and proxy servers to call people and TRAI will use AI and machine learning to detect them.

310.title: What are the features of Light Combat Helicopters that'll be inducted tomorrow?
310.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will formally induct the first batch of the made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) on Monday. The helicopters are primarily designed for deployment in high-altitude regions and have stealth features, armour protection, night attack capability and crash-worthy landing gear for better survivability. They can operate at an altitude of up to 5,000 metres with weapons.

311.title: Agarwal rushed to hospital after being hit on the head during Irani Cup
311.article_body: India batter Mayank Agarwal was reportedly rushed to the hospital after being hit on his head by a cricket ball during the Irani Cup game in Rajkot. Mayank was reportedly taken for a precautionary scan after being hit on the head with a throw. The 31-year-old scored 11 off 14 balls on Saturday for Rest of India (ROI) against Saurashtra.

312.title: 1st ever 2-day startup expo at Jammu ends, Jitendra Singh shares video
312.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh took to Twitter to share a video of the first-ever two-day startup expo in Jammu which he inaugurated. Singh said that preference for government jobs is proving to be an impediment to startup culture. During his two-day visit to Jammu, Kathua and Udhampur, he also attended a science exhibition by school students.

313.title: Honey Singh shares pic of singer Alfaaz injured after attack, warns attackers
313.article_body: Yo Yo Honey Singh took to Instagram to share a picture of Punjabi singer Alfaaz who was hospitalised after being injured in an attack. "My brother Alfaaz (was) attacked last night, whoever planned this...I won't let u go!...Everyone pls pray for him," he wrote. Celebrities wished a speedy recovery to Alfaaz in the comments, with actress Hina Khan writing, "Prayers".

314.title: Wow, what a feeling: Foden on his 1st hat-trick for Manchester City
314.article_body: Following his hat-trick in Manchester City's 6-3 win against Manchester United in the Premier League, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden tweeted, "So grateful to have got my first hat-trick for City and in the derby too!" He added, "Wow - what a feeling! Manchester is blue." Foden's teammate Erling Haaland also scored a hat-trick at the Etihad Stadium.

315.title: Shri Tulsi Tanti one of the foremost believers in Aatmanirbharta: Adani
315.article_body: Chairman of Adani Group, Gautam Adani took to Twitter to condole the death of Founder and Chairman of Suzlon Energy, Tulsi Tanti. Calling him one of the foremost believers in Aatmanirbharta, Adani called Tanti a "gifted visionary who proved that India could be a global player in the wind energy space." Tulsi Tanti passed away due to cardiac arrest.

316.title: His oxygen levels decreased a little bit: SP on Mulayam's health
316.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's oxygen levels decreased a little bit but there is no need to worry as per doctors, party leader Rakesh Yadav said. He added that Mulayam Singh's routine checkup is being done daily. Mulayam has been shifted to the intensive care unit at the Medanta Hospital in Gurugram.

317.title: Real angered being tagged as Haaland's third choice transfer: Report
317.article_body: Real Madrid have reportedly been angered by the Manchester City forward Erling Haaland's father saying that the La Liga club was their third choice transfer. Haaland's personal team reportedly had a scoring system on which club the striker should join and Madrid scored six out of 10. Real are reportedly not pleased with their name being used in such scenarios.

318.title: Can't ignore lack of confidence within team: Liverpool manager Klopp
318.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he "can't ignore the fact" that his team is suffering from a lack of confidence and momentum. "I'm not sure if concerning is the right word... We are under pressure...We have to perform more consistently," said Klopp. Liverpool is ninth in the league table with 10 points from seven games, having won only twice.

319.title: Kohli denies single in last over, asks Karthik to keep hitting despite batting on 49*
319.article_body: Virat Kohli denied Dinesh Karthik's offer to take single and asked him to attack the bowlers during India's last over despite being on 49*(28) in second T20I against South Africa. A video of the same has gone viral, with fans calling Kohli "selfless". Karthik slammed 16 runs in the last over as India put up a 237-run total.

320.title: We condemn this hate crime: India as Bhagavad Gita Park sign vandalised in Canada
320.article_body: The sign of a park named after the Bhagavad Gita was vandalised in Canada, following which the Indian High Commission in Ottawa issued a statement condemning the "hate crime". "We urge Canadian authorities and Peel Police to investigate and take prompt action on the perpetrators," it said. The government recently warned that hate crimes against Indians are rising in Canada.

321.title: What are India's 5 highest totals in T20I cricket?
321.article_body: India on Sunday recorded their fourth-highest T20I total after registering 237/3 against South Africa in Guwahati. India posted their highest-ever T20I total (260/5) against Sri Lanka in Indore on December 22, 2017. India's second-highest and third-highest T20I totals of 244/4 and 240/3, respectively, came against West Indies. India's fifth-highest T20I total (225/7) came against Ireland in June.

322.title: That's true: Mani on if Rajinikanth wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin...'
322.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has said that it's true that he rejected actor Rajinikanth, who wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "It has to be honest to the story...I can't bring in a huge superstar in between this and so I told him that I will be taking a rain check with him," Mani stated. The film features actor Vikram.

323.title: Rajamouli gets standing ovation during RRR screening in US, shares video
323.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli received a standing ovation during the screening of 'RRR' in the Chinese theatre in Los Angeles. The filmmaker took to Twitter and shared the video. Along with the video, he wrote, "Your adoration and applause towards my heroes, my film and me were enormous." The film featured Ram Charan and Jr NTR.

324.title: Disappointed with the decision: Xiaomi on ED seizing assets
324.article_body: Xiaomi said that the company is "disappointed with the decision" of FEMA authority, which approved an order of seizure of over ₹5,551 crore worth of deposits. The company said over 84% of the ₹5,551.27 crore were royalty payments made to US company Qualcomm. "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legitimate and truthful," Xiaomi said.

325.title: Will announce party soon after padayatra: Prashant Kishor
325.article_body: After embarking on a 3,500-km-long padayatra from Bihar's West Champaran, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that he will announce a political party after the yatra's culmination. "I have already announced that I will not lead it (party). I will neither be elected nor selected. But it will have a leader who will be selected from among its workers," Kishor said.

326.title: 1 man arrested in Alwar gang-rape case in Rajasthan
326.article_body: The police have arrested one man in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a 16-year-old by eight men in Rajasthan's Alwar district. They had also extorted ₹50,000 from her and circulated the video of the sexual assault online. "One of the accused identified as Akram has been detained. He is being interrogated," said Circle Officer Kishangarh Bas Atul Agre.

327.title: Worried about Mulayam Singh Yadav's health: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
327.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has expressed concern over the health condition of Samajwadi Party's founder, Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Worried about the health of Former UP CM and SP leader Thiru Mulayam Singh. Hoping that he makes a full and quick recovery," CM Stalin said. The 82-year-old Mainpuri MP was shifted to Medanta hospital in Gurugram after his health deteriorated.

328.title: Indore jail inmates play dandiya to celebrate cleanest city tag
328.article_body: A day after Indore was adjudged the cleanest city in India, inmates of the Indore Central Jail played 'dandiya' to celebrate the triumph. Officials said all prisoners, male and female, participated in the event attended by the Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur and Indore Police Commissioner. Thakur was also presented with a picture by a prisoner during the event.

329.title: Raj woman demands ₹10 lakh ransom over intimate pics, videos of man
329.article_body: A woman in Rajasthan has been booked for demanding ₹10 lakh ransom from a man, threatening to share his intimate pictures. The woman had promised to marry him. She took intimate pictures of the man and threatened to share them if she didn't get the ransom. She sent the photos to his relatives and friends after he refused to pay.

330.title: Rajasthan Police revokes transfer order stating constables' caste
330.article_body: The Rajasthan Police in Tonk district had to withdraw a transfer order after criticism for mentioning the caste of the eight constables in the list. "It was an unintentional mistake...a clerical mistake. I take the responsibility," said SP, Tonk, Manish Tripathi. The BJP claimed the police were being "politically used" and that the Congress was "encouraging casteism in police".

331.title: Assam's Kaziranga National Park reopens for tourists
331.article_body: Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve in Assam, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was reopened for tourists on October 2. The national park had been shut since May for tourists due to flooding and rains. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Isha Foundation founder Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev declared the national park open for tourists on September 22.

332.title: Ram Charan said 'I want to be with you in same frame': Salman on 'Kisi...'
332.article_body: Actor Salman Khan revealed Ram Charan told him that he wants to do a cameo in his film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. "He said 'I want to be with you in the same frame'. I thought he was...kidding...I said we'll talk about this tomorrow," he stated. Salman added Ram got his vanity van and costume next morning.

333.title: ₹40/day for every cow if AAP voted to power in Gujarat: Kejriwal
333.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised ₹40 per day for the upkeep of every cow in Gujarat if the party comes to power in the state. He also promised a shelter home for non-milch cattle in every district of the state. Addressing the controversy about the Ahmedabad auto-rickshaw driver, Kejriwal said he will not turn down an invite from anyone.

334.title: Volunteer work during pandemic helped PFI widen presence: Maha Police
334.article_body: Maharashtra Police said work done by PFI volunteers during the COVID-19 pandemic helped the organisation widen its presence in the state. PFI volunteered to perform the last rites of those who died due to COVID-19 and would volunteer during other natural calamities, said the police. The group had members in at least 22 districts of Maharashtra when it was banned.

335.title: MIT researchers build an underwater camera powered by sound
335.article_body: The researchers at MIT have created a battery-free and wireless underwater camera to image the underwater world. Powered by underwater sound, the camera captures colour images at ultra-low power and transmits them wirelessly to a remote receiver. They claim their camera consumes 1,00,000 times less energy than state-of-the-art low-power underwater imaging systems.

336.title: Sharad Kelkar to voice actor Prabhas in Adipurush's Hindi version
336.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar will voice actor Prabhas in the Hindi version of 'Adipurush'. Sharad had previously voiced Prabhas in SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' franchise. 'Adipurush', which is directed by Om Raut, will feature actress Kriti Sanon as Sita and actor Saif Ali Khan as Raavan. Prabhas will play the role of Lord Ram in the film.

337.title: No arrest warrant received over web series 'XXX', reports are false: Ekta Kapoor's lawyer
337.article_body: After reports claimed that Bihar's Begusarai court issued arrest warrants against Ekta Kapoor and her mother Shobha Kapoor, Ekta's lawyer in a statement said the reports are "false" and "inaccurate". "No arrest warrants have been received by Ekta or Shobha," the statement read. A complaint was reportedly lodged against the web series in Bihar over alleged objectionable scenes insulting Army.

338.title: Twitter launches 'immersive media viewer', similar to TikTok
338.article_body: Twitter has added full screen vertical videos to its app or an 'immersive media viewer' similar to TikTok and Instagram Reels. Twitter will also launch a video carousel in its 'Explore' tab for trending videos. "Videos are a huge part of the public conversation, and they're one of the most engaging ways people can express themselves online," Twitter said.

339.title: Member of PFI, Tablighi Jamaat arrested in UP's Ayodhya
339.article_body: An activist of the banned outfit, PFI, was arrested in UP's Ayodhya for allegedly being involved in anti-national activities and provoking Muslims. The accused, Mohammad Zaid, is also an active member of the Tablighi Jamaat, police said. Zaid's father, Mohammed Haneef, has claimed that police had kept his son under illegal detention for the past four days.

340.title: Haaland, Foden net hat-tricks as Man City beat Man United 6-3 in PL
340.article_body: Erling Haaland and Phil Foden both scored derby hat-tricks as Manchester City beat Manchester United 6-3 in Premier League on Sunday. Manchester City have become only the third side in Premier League history to have two players score hat-tricks in a single match. With 20 points from eight matches, Manchester City are one point behind leaders Arsenal in the standings.

341.title: India's batting is doing well ahead of T20 WC: Aakash Chopra
341.article_body: Ex-cricketer Aakash Chopra said that looking at India's overall preparations for the upcoming T20 World Cup, the side's batting unit is doing well. "When Hardik Pandya comes in for Rishabh Pant, the batting will get stronger. Axar Patel is also scoring runs, so there are no worries," Chopra said. He added that there will be no dew in Australia.

342.title: No one can stop us: Rahul addresses rally amid heavy rains in K'taka
342.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi addressed a public rally in Karnataka's Mysuru during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' amid heavy rains on Sunday. “In uniting India, no one can stop us. From raising...voice of India, no one can stop us. Will go from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir, no one can stop Bharat Jodo Yatra," Gandhi said. Congress shared a video from the rally.

343.title: CCTV video shows the moment terrorists opened fire at security forces in Pulwama
343.article_body: A CCTV video has emerged of the moment security forces came under attack from terrorists in the Pinglana area of J&K's Pulwama on Sunday. The attack led to the death of one policeman and injured a CRPF jawan. Terrorists opened fire at a checkpoint in the area, hours after a terrorist linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba was shot dead in Shopian.

344.title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks world record for taking fewest balls to reach 1,000 T20I runs
344.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has broken the world record for taking the fewest number of balls to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket, achieving the feat in the second T20I against South Africa on Sunday. The 32-year-old took 573 deliveries to reach the 1,000-run mark. He overtook Australia's Glenn Maxwell, who had taken 604 deliveries to reach the milestone.

345.title: Violence? On Gandhi Jayanti? Against South Africa? Jaffer as India score 237/3 in 2nd T20I
345.article_body: Reacting to India smashing a total of 237/3 in their 20 overs against South Africa, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Violence? On Gandhi Jayanti? Against South Africa?!" The total is India's highest against South Africa in T20I cricket and overall their fourth highest total in T20I cricket. India slammed 13 sixes in their innings.

346.title: UP restricts use of tractors as public transport after Kanpur accident
346.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Transport Department has issued an order restricting the use of tractors as public transport. The order stated that tractors and trolleys should be used for agriculture-related works and transportation of goods only. This comes a day after 26 people were killed when a tractor-trolley overturned and fell into a pond on Unnao-Kanpur road.

347.title: Man arrested for raping 18-year-old Dalit woman in UP's Ballia
347.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly raping an 18-year-old Dalit woman in a village in Ballia, UP. The victim alleged that the accused, Rahul Rajbhar (22), raped her after dragging her to a sugarcane field. Rajbhar allegedly made the video of the act and posted it on social media, police said.

348.title: After snake, floodlight failure halts India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati; pic surfaces
348.article_body: After the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati was stopped briefly due to a snake on the pitch during India's innings, the match was halted again after 2.1 overs of South Africa's innings due to floodlight failure. Pictures of one of the malfunctioning floodlights surfaced online. Several fans criticised the organisers over multiple delays in the match.

349.title: Anyone have issues with his strike rate now: Uthappa on Rahul's 57(28) vs SA
349.article_body: Reacting to India opener KL Rahul's 28-ball 57 in second T20I against South Africa, ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa took to Twitter and wrote, "Anyone have issues with KL Rahul's strike rate now?" Rahul scored his 20th T20I half-century off 24 balls at a strike rate of 203.57. He hit five fours and four sixes during his knock in Guwahati.

350.title: When will we play with our strongest XI: Rajkumar on India ahead of T20 WC
350.article_body: Commenting on changes in Team India's playing XI ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "My question is when will we play with our strongest XI?" He added, "We still don't know what our first-choice XI is keeping in mind all the injuries." The T20 World Cup will begin on October 16.

351.title: India record their highest-ever T20I total against South Africa
351.article_body: India on Sunday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against South Africa after registering 237/3 in their 20 overs in the second T20I in Guwahati. Suryakumar Yadav top-scored for India with 61 runs off 22 deliveries. India's previous highest T20I total against South Africa had come on June 9, 2022, when they recorded 211/4 in Delhi.
