352.title: Chinese film 'Return to Dust' disappears from the country's cinemas, internet
352.article_body: Chinese film 'Return to Dust' has been withdrawn from cinemas and streaming platforms in the country despite earning 100 million yuan at the box office. Released in China on July 8, the film depicts the hardships of life in rural China. "We didn't receive an official document to block the film," a person associated with the film's makers said.

353.title: What are the new UAE Green Visa, Golden Visa rules effective from tomorrow?
353.article_body: As per new rules effective from October 3, UAE will allow tourists with valid visas to enter and stay for 60 days. The five-year Green Residence Visa will allow foreigners to sponsor themselves without reliance on employers, with a provision for getting residence permits for their families. Golden Visas will now remain valid irrespective of the time spent in UAE.

354.title: Working to protect 10,000 customers after Optus attack: Australian police
354.article_body: Australian police said they've begun operation to protect personal information of 10,000 people whose data may have been shared online after a cyber attack on Optus. This comes days after hackers released details of Optus' customers, saying they wouldn't stop posting details until they receive $1 million. Affected people may have had their 100-point identification compromised, police said.

355.title: Police official suspended after Moosewala murder accused escapes custody
355.article_body: Punjab Director General of Police (DGP) Gaurav Yadav on Sunday said that an FIR has been filed and an officer has been suspended after Sidhu Moosewala murder accused, Deepak Tinu escaped from police custody. Tinu managed to ditch CIA officials when he was being brought from Kapurthala Jail to Mansa on remand in a private vehicle Saturday night, officials said.

356.title: Rohit gets frustrated after umpire doesn't call wide, video of his reaction goes viral
356.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma getting frustrated after umpire didn't signal a leg-side wide in the second over during the second T20I against South Africa. The umpire thought that the ball touched Rohit's body before going to wicketkeeper, however, the replays confirmed no contact. Rohit then mockingly signalled DRS to show his disappointment.

357.title: Video of Virat Kohli giving pep talk to Team India goes viral, fans react
357.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli giving a pep talk to the team ahead of the second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Still a leader, King Kohli." Another wrote, "King doing the talking." "Virat masterclass," another tweet read.

358.title: Rajesh Khanna stopped talking after I contested election against him: Shatrughan
358.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha revealed late actor Rajesh Khanna had stopped talking to him after Shatrughan contested the election in Delhi against him. Shatrughan said he was set against Rajesh after LK Advani had to let go of his Delhi seat after winning in Gandhinagar. "I tried to sort things out. I...said sorry to him after a few years," he added.

359.title: 5G launch heralding new era of Digital India: Dr Kalam's tech advisor
359.article_body: SP Singh, ex-President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam's technology and policy advisor, said launch of 5G services in India "is truly heralding a new era of Digital India". 5G is expected to impact a wide array of industries, including agriculture, healthcare, education and governance, Singh said. Applications powered by 5G are expected to produce over $12 trillion by 2035, he added.

360.title: Apple may soon launch new classical music-streaming app: Report
360.article_body: Apple may soon launch a new music app, focused on classical recordings, alongside its existing Apple Music app, The Independent reported citing hidden code. Apple had announced the new app in August 2021, when it bought classical music streaming service Primephonic, and said it would arrive before 2022-end. It hasn't mentioned the new classical music-streaming app since the announcement.

361.title: Colonialism not dead: Uday Kotak's son on UK, India's borrowing rates
361.article_body: Jay Kotak, Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO and billionaire Uday Kotak's son, compared borrowing rates in the UK and India saying, "Colonialism isn't entirely dead!" "India borrows at 7.5% [while] the UK at 4% (10 year government bond). India has similar GDP, higher GDP growth & forex reserves, lower exchange rate depreciation, public debt and fiscal deficit to GDP!" he added.

362.title: PM Modi, Vice President Dhankhar attend prayer meet at Gandhi Smriti
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi attended a prayer meeting organised on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti at Gandhi Smriti in Delhi on Sunday. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was also present there. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri at Rajghat and Vijay Ghat respectively.

363.title: I'd like to bat with Jemimah: Anjum after India batter's match-winning 76
363.article_body: Praising India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues following her match-winning knock against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, ex-India captain Anjum Chopra said, "I would like to bat with Jemimah." She added, "She is a busy player and always seems to be looking for that quick single. My game was based on the same theory." Jemimah top-scored with a 53-ball 76.

364.title: Hope the world takes note: Mahindra as Indore celebrates cleanest city award
364.article_body: Anand Mahindra shared a video of people celebrating as Indore bagged the cleanest city award for the sixth time in a row, calling it a "real mindset transformation". He said, "The world sees India as a country where we dance and celebrate on many occasions. I hope the world will notice this new occasion for celebration."

365.title: Was kicked out of 'Housefull 4', my credit was taken away: Sajid Khan
365.article_body: Filmmaker Sajid Khan, speaking about 'Housefull 4', said, "I was making 'Housefull 4' but got kicked out of the movie. My credit was taken away." "I felt like this was all the god's way of telling me that you've to become...nicer person," he added. Several women had accused Sajid of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in 2018.

366.title: Not scared of such threats: Maha CM Shinde on threat to life report
366.article_body: Responding to a threat to life report, following which his security has been tightened, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he wasn't scared of such threats. "I don't pay attention to it. Our Home Department and Home Minister Devendra Fadnavis are capable and we trust them," he said, adding that nobody can stop him from working for the public.

367.title: Snake enters field during India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati, video goes viral
367.article_body: The play during the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati was briefly halted after a snake entered the field. The snake was spotted after India's seventh over. Several groundsmen came on the field and escorted the snake away from the playing area after which the game resumed. "Never saw a snake stopping a cricket match," a fan tweeted.

368.title: If Ind's WC campaign is centred on winning toss, it's big worry: Chopra
368.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra said that it's a big worry if India's entire T20 World Cup campaign is centred on winning the toss. "They (India) failed to defend against Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup," Chopra said. He added, "But if they keep fielding first, they might suffer when the toss doesn't go their way."

369.title: Pic shows the car ex-PM Lal Bahadur Shastri bought after taking a ₹5,000 loan
369.article_body: Former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri's grandson Vibhakar Shastri took to Twitter to share a picture of the car that belonged to the former PM. "Shastri Ji took a loan of ₹5,000 from the bank to buy this car...After his death, the loan was repaid by Smt. Lalita Shastri," he tweeted. Sunday marked the 118th birth anniversary of the former PM.

370.title: ONDC floats consultation paper for public to comment on 24 issues
370.article_body: The Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) has floated a consultation paper to seek comments of the public on 24 issues relating to payments, fulfilment of orders, refunds and cancellations. ONDC is hoping to democratise the e-commerce segment in India and is seeking to build trust among the participants. The ONDC called it an "open consultation".

371.title: Airox Technologies aims to raise ₹750 cr IPO, files papers with SEBI
371.article_body: Medical oxygen supplier Airox Technologies has filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI to raise ₹750 crore via an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will entirely be an offer-for-sale (OFS) by shareholders Sanjay Bharatkumar Jaiswal and Ashima Sanjay Jaiswal. Sanjay and Ashima intend to sell shares worth ₹525 crore and ₹225 crore respectively.

372.title: His condition is stable: SP after Mulayam Singh admitted to ICU
372.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's condition is stable, the party said in a statement on Sunday. He was shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital in Gurugram earlier in the day. The Samajwadi Party said the 82-year-old leader is being treated under the supervision of senior doctors.

373.title: SEBI tightens disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies
373.article_body: SEBI approved new mandates including tightening of disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies. In its board meeting, the market regulator allowed companies for confidential pre-filing of offer documents along with relaxing open offer pricing rules for disinvestment of public sector undertakings (PSUs). As per the new norms, buying and selling of mutual funds falls under insider trading rules.

374.title: Windfall profit tax cut on domestic crude oil, diesel; scrapped for jet fuel
374.article_body: According to a Finance Ministry notification issued late Saturday night, the tax on domestically produced crude oil was reduced from ₹10,500 to ₹8,000 per tonne. The levy on the diesel export was reduced to ₹5 per litre from ₹10 per litre. The government also scrapped the export tax on jet fuel completely. All the changes will be effective immediately.

375.title: Karthi pens note after 'Ponniyin Selvan' collects ₹150 cr worldwide
375.article_body: Actor Karthi, who played Vallavaraiyan Vanthiyathevan in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', took to Twitter and penned a note for his fans. "Words cannot express the immense gratitude I feel for this experience and magnificent journey as Vanthiyethevan...It's overwhelming to receive all your love," Karthi wrote. This comes after his film crossed ₹150 crore gross worldwide as per Trade analyst Ramesh Bala.

376.title: Kohli needed break to re-energise his battery: Shane Watson
376.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that Indian batter Virat Kohli needed "some time off to re-energise his battery". "I could see from even far, during the last IPL, you could see his energy was low. He was trying to get his best," Watson said. He added, "He is at the peak of his powers...Great to see him at his best."

377.title: DPIIT to seek Cabinet nod for bill to decriminalise minor offences: Official
377.article_body: According to an official, the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) will soon seek the Cabinet's approval for The Ease of Doing Business and Ease of Living (Amendment of Provisions) Bill, 2022. The bill aims to decriminalise minor offences by rationalising about 110 provisions across 35 Acts under different ministries to ensure ease of doing business.

378.title: Rohit Sharma becomes first Indian to play 400 matches in T20 cricket history
378.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has become the first-ever Indian cricketer to feature in 400 matches in T20 cricket history. India's second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati marks Rohit's 400th T20 match. West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard holds the record of playing the most number of T20 matches (614).

379.title: Ethiopia's 23-yr-old Yehualaw becomes youngest-ever winner of London marathon
379.article_body: Ethiopia's 23-year-old Yalemzerf Yehualaw became the youngest-ever winner of the London marathon, finishing in two hours, 17 minutes and 26 seconds. Notably, it's the third fastest women's London Marathon time in history. Yehualaw, who tripped during the run, said she's happy to win in London. Kenya's Amos Kipruto won the men's race in two hours, four minutes and 39 seconds.

380.title: 50-year-old man's body recovered from well in Rajasthan
380.article_body: The body of a 50-year-old man was recovered from a well at his farm in Haipura village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The feet of the deceased, Hemraj Lodha, were tied with a towel, police said. There was a dispute between Hemraj and his two nephews, Vinod (33) and Mohan (22), over some portion of land, police added.

381.title: NASA finds mystery object stuck to Mars Helicopter's foot during latest flight
381.article_body: NASA said it noticed a mysterious object stuck to the foot of the Ingenuity Mars Helicopter during its latest flight on the red planet. "There's something on your foot, Mars Helicopter! We're looking into a bit of debris that ended up on Ingenuity's foot," said NASA while sharing visuals of the debris. The object didn't impact its flight, NASA said.

382.title: Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram': SP's Abu Azmi on Maha govt's GR
382.article_body: SP leader Abu Azmi on Sunday said that Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello' while addressing public or government officials and making announcements. His response came following the Maharashtra government's Government Resolution, directing government employees to greet with 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello'. Eknath Shinde has come under the pressure of BJP and RSS, Azmi added.

383.title: Officials warn of threat to Maharashtra CM Shinde's life; security tightened
383.article_body: The State Intelligence Department (SID) has received specific input about the threat to the life of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, following which his security has been tightened further, an official said on Sunday. Shinde already has a 'Z Plus' category security cover. Security has also been increased at Shinde's private residence in Thane and the official residence 'Varsha' in Mumbai.

384.title: Electric scooter battery explosion kills 7-year-old boy near Mumbai
384.article_body: A seven-year-old child was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging near Mumbai, police said. The incident took place on September 23 when the deceased's father had kept the battery on charge around 2:30 am before the sound of an explosion woke him up around 5:30 am. The deceased succumbed to injuries on September 30.

385.title: 35-year-old woman dies after being burnt alive by husband in Thane
385.article_body: A 35-year-old woman, who was allegedly burnt alive by her husband in Thane, died while undergoing treatment. The accused, who was having an affair, hatched a plan to get rid of his wife and two daughters (who are undergoing treatment) by burning them alive and making it look like an accident. The accused also got injured in the incident.

386.title: Jio to launch 4G-enabled laptop for ₹15,000: Report
386.article_body: Reliance Jio will be launching a laptop with an embedded 4G sim card for ₹15,000, Reuters reported on Sunday. The company has partnered with companies like Qualcomm and Microsoft for the 'JioBook'. The laptop will be available to enterprise customers like schools and government institutes from this month, with a consumer launch expected within the next three months.

387.title: FPIs withdraw ₹7,624 cr in Sept, turn net sellers after 2 months
387.article_body: After remaining net buyers in the last two months, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have turned net sellers again in September and withdrawn ₹7,624 crore from Indian equity markets. Data with depositories showed that total outflow from Indian equity markets by FPIs has reached ₹1.68 lakh crore so far in 2022. FPIs had invested ₹51,200 crore in August.

388.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against South Africa
388.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India in Guwahati. India are fielding the same side that played in the first T20I. Meanwhile, South Africa have made one change to their playing XI, with Lungi Ngidi replacing Tabraiz Shamsi.

389.title: Indian women's team registers 1st win in Group 5 at World Team TT C'ships
389.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team defeated the Czech Republic 3-0 to register their first win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Sunday. Manika Batra and Diya Chitale won their respective matches 3-1, while Sreeja Akula won 3-0. India are currently second in the group standings. India lost to Germany in their first match.

390.title: Hyd Police foils conspiracy to kill BJP-RSS leaders, 3 held
390.article_body: The Commissioner's Taskforce, along with the state intelligence department on Sunday, foiled an attempt to assassinate BJP and RSS leaders by detaining a few suspects from Hyderabad's Malakpet area. The accused hatched the conspiracy at the behest of foreign handlers based in Pakistan, police said, adding that they got explosives to carry out the plan.

391.title: Leaders like Kharge can't bring change: Tharoor amid Cong Prez polls
391.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge can't bring change and will continue the existing system. "We aren't enemies, it's not war. It's a poll for our party's future. Kharge ji comes in the top three leaders of Congress," he said. I will bring change as per party workers' expectations, Tharoor said.

392.title: 13 firms sign non-disclosure agreement with govt to use ULIP data
392.article_body: As many as 13 firms have signed a non-disclosure agreement with the government to access data from the Unified Logistics Interface Platform (ULIP), the Commerce and Industry Ministry said on Saturday. The 13 firms include MapmyIndia and Yes Bank. It added that 11 more organisations, including Bosch India, Portlinks and Shiprocket, are in the process of signing the agreement.

393.title: India squad for ODI series against South Africa announced
393.article_body: The BCCI on Sunday announced Team India squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain of the squad, while Shreyas Iyer will be his deputy. Batter Rajat Patidar and fast bowler Mukesh Kumar have received their maiden Team India call-ups. The squad also includes Mohammed Siraj, Avesh Khan and Shahbaz Ahmed.

394.title: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav reaches Gurugram hospital where Mulayam is admitted
394.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram where his father and SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted. Mulayam has been shifted to the intensive care unit at the hospital. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya wished him a speedy recovery.

395.title: Truly blessed, humbled: 'Tanhaji' director on winning 3 National Awards
395.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut took to Instagram after his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards. "I'm truly blessed...humbled and will use this honour, that's bestowed upon me, as a symbol to try harder to entertain everyone for years to come," he wrote. The film won a National Award for Best Popular Film, Best Costume Design and Best Actor.

396.title: We were going to end 'Brahmāstra 1' with Dev's face reveal: Ayan
396.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said they were going to end 'Brahmāstra: Part One' with Dev's face reveal. "It was with a lot of thought...to create some curiosity in the minds of the audiences that we ended the film where we did," Ayan added. Ayan said Dev could be the "most exciting character" he will be taking on in his career.

397.title: Heroin worth ₹34 cr concealed in trolley bag seized at Mumbai airport
397.article_body: Around five kilograms of heroin, worth ₹34 crore, which was concealed in a cavity inside a trolley bag, was seized by the Customs department at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport on Sunday. A passenger has been held by the officials. In another incident, a woman was held with cocaine worth ₹4.9 crore at the Mumbai airport.

398.title: Increased repo rate big dampener for us: Automobile industry body
398.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) President MR Singhania said hike in repo rate is a "big dampener" for the automobile industry, particularly for price-sensitive entry-level two-wheelers and passenger vehicles segments. RBI on Friday raised repo rate by 50 bps, the fourth straight increase since May 2022. Manufacturers of two-wheelers hiked prices five times in 2021, he added.

399.title: AAP to form govt in Gujarat, says Kejriwal; cites 'IB report'
399.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while citing an "Intelligence Bureau report", said that AAP will form the government in Gujarat if elections are held on Sunday. However, he claimed that his party will form the government in Gujarat with a very thin margin and urged the people of the state to give a "big push" to AAP.

400.title: OPEC+ to consider oil output cut of over 1 million barrels per day: Reports
400.article_body: According to reports, OPEC+ is mulling an oil output cut of over a million barrels per day when it meets on October 5. OPEC+, consisting of OPEC countries and allies like Russia, will meet in person in Vienna for the first time since March 2020. The output cuts are being considered after the fall in global oil rates.

401.title: 198-kg meth, 9-kg cocaine worth ₹1,476 crore seized in Navi Mumbai
401.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 198 kg of methamphetamine and 9 kg of cocaine, totalling ₹1,476 crore in Navi Mumbai. The department said the consignment belonged to drug cartels in South Africa, and India was being used as a transit country. "They conceal drugs in the boxes of Valencia oranges imported from South Africa," said an official.
